oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Radio Broadcast - Benny Goodman's Camel Caravan and America Swings - 1938-09-06 and 1939-09-02
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Air checks made for the William Esty Advertising Agency. Two shows. Each show is divided into parts one and two. 1938 show is from Chicago, Illinois. 1939 show is from Detroit Michigan.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Benny Goodman; The Goodman Swing Band; Martha Tilton; Jess Stacy; The Goodman Instrumental trio; Teddy Wilson; Lionel Hampton; Dan Seymour; Bert Parks; Louise Tobin; Charlie Christian; Chris Griffin; Fletcher Henderson; Dave Tough; Toots Mondello; Ziggy Elman;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: 1938-09-06 program (00:00) Opening advertisement and theme with voice over by Dan Seymour with introduction of Benny Goodman / (00:56) Goodman's opening comments / (01:12) Chicago (Goodman band) / (03:45) Martha Tilton and Goodman introduce next song / (04:03) I've Got A Date With A Dream (Martha Tilton with the Goodman band) / (07:17) Camel cigarette commercial / (08:15) Margie (Goodman band) / 10:35 Benny introduces Jess Stacy / (11:04) In A Mist (Jess Stacy - piano) / (14:05) END OF PART ONE / (14:06) Tilton and Goodman introduce next song / (14:30) The Lambeth Walk (Martha Tilton with the Goodman band) / (17:03) Camel cigarette commercial / (17:57) Shine (Goodman quartet with Teddy Wilson, Lionel Hampton, Dave Tough and Benny Goodman) / (20:58) Tilton introduces next song / (21:13) You Go To My Head (Martha Tilton with the Goodman band) / (23:56) Goodman introduces next song chosen by the audience / (24:12) Madhouse (The Goodman band) /

(27:43) Closing theme with Goodman's closing comments and voice over announcement / (28:40) Prince Albert tobacco commercial and CBS radio system tag (Digital glitch audible) / (29:35 ) 1939-09-02 program (29:37) NBC chimes and WEAF New York radio tag / (29:58) Introduction of Benny Goodman and America Swings by Bert Parks / (30:48) Goodman's opening comments with listing of coming personal appearances / (31:37) If I Could Be With You (One Hour Tonight) (Goodman band) / (34:08) Bert Parks introduces next song / (34:33) Day In, Day Out (Louise Tobin with the Goodman band) / (37:19) Bert Parks with Camel cigarette commercial / (38:29) Stardust (Goodman Sextet with Lionel Hampton and Charlie Christian) / (40:51) Goodman introduces next song and talks with Lionel Hampton about the lyrics / (42:20) Jumpin' Jive (Louise Tobin with the Goodman band) / END OF PART ONE / (44:40) Goodman introduction of next song and introduces Fletcher Henderson, Toots Mondello, Ziggy Elman /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Goodman, Benny, 1909-1986; Tilton, Martha; Stacy, Jess, 1904-1995; Hampton, Lionel; Wilson, Teddy, 1912-1986; Seymour, Dan; Park, Bert; Tobin, Louise; Christian, Charlie, 1916-1942; Griffin, Chris, 1915-2005; Henderson, Fletcher, 1897-1952; Tough, Dave; Mondello, Toots; Elman, Ziggy; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
